query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Chi poria mai pur con parole sciolte 2 dicer del sangue e de le piaghe a pieno 3 ch’i’ ora vidi, per narrar più volte?
4 Ogne lingua per certo verria meno 5 per lo nostro sermone e per la mente 6 c’hanno a tanto comprender poco seno.
query.result:
**English:**
1 Who could ever, even with fluent speech, 2 fully tell of the blood and the wounds 3 that I saw there, to recount them many times?
4 Surely every tongue would fail 5 because of our speech and our minds, 6 which have too little capacity to grasp so much.
**Malay:**
1 Siapa yang dapat, bahkan dengan kata-kata yang lancar, 2 menceritakan darah dan luka-luka dengan sepenuhnya 3 yang kulihat saat itu, untuk menceritakannya berkali-kali?
4 Pasti setiap bahasa akan gagal 5 karena ucapan dan pikiran kita, 6 yang memiliki kapasitas yang terlalu sedikit untuk memahami begitu banyak hal.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
7 S’el s’aunasse ancor tutta la gente 8 che già, in su la fortunata terra 9 di Puglia, fu del suo sangue dolente
10 per li Troiani e per la lunga guerra 11 che de l’anella fé sì alte spoglie, 12 come Livïo scrive, che non erra,
13 con quella che sentio di colpi doglie 14 per contastare a Ruberto Guiscardo; 15 e l’altra il cui ossame ancor s’accoglie
16 a Ceperan, là dove fu bugiardo 17 ciascun Pugliese, e là da Tagliacozzo, 18 dove sanz’ arme vinse il vecchio Alardo;
19 e qual forato suo membro e qual mozzo 20 mostrasse, d’aequar sarebbe nulla 21 il modo de la nona bolgia sozzo.
query.result:
**English:**
7 If all the people who once 8 in the fortunate land of Puglia 9 grieved for their blood,
10 because of the Trojans and the long war 11 that made such great spoils of rings, 12 as Livy writes, who does not err,
13 together with her who felt the pangs of childbirth 14 to oppose Robert Guiscard; 15 and the other whose bones are still gathered
16 at Ceperano, where every Apulian 17 was a liar, and there at Tagliacozzo, 18 where the old Alardo conquered without arms;
19 and whoever showed his member pierced or cut off, 20 the manner of the filthy ninth ditch 21 would be nothing to compare with.
**Malay:**
7 Jika semua orang yang pernah 8 di tanah Puglia yang beruntung 9 berduka atas darah mereka,
10 karena orang-orang Troya dan perang yang panjang 11 yang membuat rampasan cincin yang begitu besar, 12 seperti yang ditulis Livy, yang tidak salah,
13 bersama dengan dia yang merasakan sakit melahirkan 14 untuk melawan Robert Guiscard; 15 dan yang lainnya yang tulangnya masih terkumpul
16 di Ceperano, di mana setiap orang Apulia 17 adalah pembohong, dan di sana di Tagliacozzo, 18 di mana Alardo tua menang tanpa senjata;
19 dan siapa pun yang menunjukkan anggotanya tertusuk atau terpotong, 20 cara parit kesembilan yang kotor 21 tidak akan ada bandingannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Già veggia, per mezzul perdere o lulla, 23 com’ io vidi un, così non si pertugia, 24 rotto dal mento infin dove si trulla.
query.result:
**English:**
22 Already I could see, because of the half-lost light, 23 how I saw one, so one does not bore a hole, 24 broken from the chin down to where one breaks wind.
**Malay:**
22 Sudah dapat kulihat, karena cahaya yang setengah hilang, 23 bagaimana aku melihat seseorang, tidak ada yang seperti itu, 24 patah dari dagu hingga ke tempat kentut.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
25 Tra le gambe pendevan le minugia; 26 la corata pareva e ’l tristo sacco 27 che merda fa di quel che si trangugia.
query.result:
**English:**
25 Between his legs his entrails dangled down; 26 his stomach and the wretched sack 27 that turns to dung whatever it devours were visible.
**Malay:**
25 Di antara kedua kakinya, ususnya menjuntai ke bawah; 26 perutnya dan kantong yang menyedihkan itu 27 yang menjadikan kotoran dari apa yang ditelannya terlihat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 Mentre che tutto in lui veder m’attacco, 29 guardommi e con le man s’aperse il petto, 30 dicendo: «Or vedi com’ io mi dilacco!
31 vedi come storpiato è Mäometto! 32 Dinanzi a me sen va piangendo Alì, 33 fesso nel volto dal mento al ciuffetto.
query.result:
**English:**
28 While I was intent on gazing at him, 29 he looked at me and tore open his chest with his hands, 30 saying: "Now see how I rend myself!
31 See how Mohammed is mutilated! 32 Ali goes weeping in front of me, 33 his face split from chin to forelock.
**Malay:**
28 Sementara aku tekun menatapnya, 29 dia menatapku dan merobek dadanya dengan tangannya, 30 berkata: "Sekarang lihatlah bagaimana aku mencabik-cabik diriku sendiri!
31 Lihatlah bagaimana Muhammad dimutilasi! 32 Ali berjalan menangis di depanku, 33 wajahnya terbelah dari dagu hingga jambul.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 E tutti li altri che tu vedi qui, 35 seminator di scandalo e di scisma 36 fuor vivi, e però son fessi così.
query.result:
**English:**
34 And all the others that you see here, 35 sowers of scandal and schism, 36 were alive outside, and therefore they are split like this.
**Malay:**
34 Dan semua yang lain yang kaulihat di sini, 35 penabur skandal dan perpecahan 36 hidup di luar, dan karena itu mereka terbelah seperti ini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Un diavolo è qua dietro che n’accisma 38 sì crudelmente, al taglio de la spada 39 rimettendo ciascun di questa risma,
40 quand’ avem volta la dolente strada; 41 però che le ferite son richiuse 42 prima ch’altri dinanzi li rivada.
query.result:
**English:**
37 A devil is here behind who slaughters them 38 so cruelly, at the cut of the sword 39 sending each one of this ream back,
40 when we have turned back on the sorrowful road; 41 because the wounds are closed up 42 before another comes back in front of them.
**Malay:**
37 Seekor iblis ada di belakang yang membunuh mereka 38 dengan sangat kejam, pada tebasan pedang 39 mengirim kembali setiap orang dari kelompok ini,
40 ketika kita telah berbalik di jalan yang menyedihkan; 41 karena luka-luka itu tertutup 42 sebelum yang lain datang kembali di depan mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
43 Ma tu chi se’ che ’n su lo scoglio muse, 44 forse per indugiar d’ire a la pena 45 ch’è giudicata in su le tue accuse?».
query.result:
**English:**
43 But who are you who muse upon the rock, 44 perhaps to delay going to the punishment 45 that is judged based on your accusations?”.
**Malay:**
43 Tetapi siapakah engkau yang termenung di atas batu, 44 mungkin untuk menunda pergi ke hukuman 45 yang dijatuhkan berdasarkan tuduhanmu?”.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 «Né morte ’l giunse ancor, né colpa ’l mena», 47 rispuose ’l mio maestro, «a tormentarlo; 48 ma per dar lui esperïenza piena,
49 a me, che morto son, convien menarlo 50 per lo ’nferno qua giù di giro in giro; 51 e quest’ è ver così com’ io ti parlo».
query.result:
**English:**
46 "Neither death has reached him yet, nor sin leads him," 47 replied my master, "to torment him; 48 but in order to give him full experience,
49 to me, who am dead, it is necessary to lead him 50 through hell down here, round and round; 51 and this is true, just as I am telling you."
**Malay:**
46 "Kematian belum mencapainya, dan dosa tidak membawanya," 47 jawab guruku, "untuk menyiksanya; 48 tetapi untuk memberinya pengalaman penuh,
49 kepadaku, yang sudah mati, perlu membawanya 50 melalui neraka di sini, berputar-putar; 51 dan ini benar, sebagaimana aku katakan padamu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 Più fuor di cento che, quando l’udiro, 53 s’arrestaron nel fosso a riguardarmi 54 per maraviglia, oblïando il martiro.
query.result:
**English:**
52 More than a hundred who, when they heard me, 53 stopped in the ditch to look at me 54 in wonder, forgetting their torment.
**Malay:**
52 Lebih dari seratus orang yang, ketika mereka mendengar aku, 53 berhenti di parit untuk melihatku 54 dengan heran, melupakan siksaan mereka.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
55 «Or dì a fra Dolcin dunque che s’armi, 56 tu che forse vedra’ il sole in breve, 57 s’ello non vuol qui tosto seguitarmi,
58 sì di vivanda, che stretta di neve 59 non rechi la vittoria al Noarese, 60 ch’altrimenti acquistar non saria leve».
query.result:
**English:**
55 "Now then, tell Fra Dolcino to arm himself, 56 you who perhaps will soon see the sun, 57 if he does not want to follow me here soon,
58 with enough food, so that the harsh snow 59 does not bring victory to the Novarese, 60 which otherwise would not be easy to achieve."
**Malay:**
55 "Sekarang, katakan kepada Fra Dolcino supaya mempersenjatai dirinya, 56 kamu yang mungkin akan segera melihat matahari, 57 jika dia tidak ingin segera mengikutiku ke sini,
58 dengan cukup makanan, sehingga salju yang lebat 59 tidak membawa kemenangan bagi orang-orang Novara, 60 yang jika tidak demikian tidak akan mudah untuk dicapai."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
61 Poi che l’un piè per girsene sospese, 62 Mäometto mi disse esta parola; 63 indi a partirsi in terra lo distese.
query.result:
**English:**
61 Then, when one foot was about to move forward, 62 Muhammad spoke these words to me; 63 then he stretched himself out on the ground to depart.
**Malay:**
61 Kemudian, ketika satu kaki hendak melangkah maju, 62 Muhammad mengucapkan kata-kata ini kepadaku; 63 lalu ia membaringkan dirinya di tanah untuk berangkat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Un altro, che forata avea la gola 65 e tronco ’l naso infin sotto le ciglia, 66 e non avea mai ch’una orecchia sola,
67 ristato a riguardar per maraviglia 68 con li altri, innanzi a li altri aprì la canna, 69 ch’era di fuor d’ogne parte vermiglia,
70 e disse: «O tu cui colpa non condanna 71 e cu’ io vidi su in terra latina, 72 se troppa simiglianza non m’inganna,
73 rimembriti di Pier da Medicina, 74 se mai torni a veder lo dolce piano 75 che da Vercelli a Marcabò dichina.
query.result:
**English:**
64 Another, whose throat had been pierced through, 65 and his nose cut off right up to his eyebrows, 66 and who had only one ear left,
67 stopped to look in wonder 68 with the others, and before the others he opened his throat, 69 which was red all over on the outside,
70 and said: "O you whom no fault condemns, 71 and whom I saw up there in the land of the Latins, 72 if too much resemblance does not deceive me,
73 remember Pier da Medicina, 74 if ever you return to see the sweet plain 75 that slopes down from Vercelli to Marcabò.
**Malay:**
64 Seorang lagi, yang kerongkongannya telah tertusuk 65 dan hidungnya terpotong hingga di bawah alis, 66 dan yang hanya memiliki satu telinga,
67 berhenti untuk melihat dengan heran 68 bersama yang lain, dan sebelum yang lain dia membuka kerongkongannya, 69 yang berwarna merah di seluruh bagian luarnya,
70 dan berkata: "Hai kamu yang tidak dihukum oleh kesalahan, 71 dan yang kulihat di atas sana di tanah Latin, 72 jika kemiripan yang terlalu banyak tidak menipuku,
73 ingatlah Pier da Medicina, 74 jika kamu kembali untuk melihat dataran rendah yang manis 75 yang menurun dari Vercelli ke Marcabò.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 E fa saper a’ due miglior da Fano, 77 a messer Guido e anco ad Angiolello, 78 che, se l’antiveder qui non è vano,
79 gittati saran fuor di lor vasello 80 e mazzerati presso a la Cattolica 81 per tradimento d’un tiranno fello.
query.result:
**English:**
76 And let the two worthies from Fano know, 77 Messer Guido and Angiolello too, 78 that if my foresight is not in vain,
79 they will be thrown out of their ship 80 and massacred near Cattolica 81 through the treachery of a cruel tyrant.
**Malay:**
76 Dan beritahukan kepada dua orang yang lebih baik dari Fano, 77 kepada Tuan Guido dan juga Angiolello, 78 bahwa jika pandangan ke depan saya tidak sia-sia,
79 mereka akan terlempar keluar dari kapal mereka 80 dan dibantai di dekat Cattolica 81 karena pengkhianatan seorang tiran yang kejam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
82 Tra l’isola di Cipri e di Maiolica 83 non vide mai sì gran fallo Nettuno, 84 non da pirate, non da gente argolica.
query.result:
**English:**
82 Between the island of Cyprus and Majorca 83 Neptune never saw such a great disaster, 84 not from pirates, not from the Argive people.
**Malay:**
82 Di antara pulau Siprus dan Majorca 83 Neptunus tidak pernah melihat bencana sebesar itu, 84 bukan dari bajak laut, bukan dari orang-orang Argive.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
85 Quel traditor che vede pur con l’uno, 86 e tien la terra che tale qui meco 87 vorrebbe di vedere esser digiuno,
88 farà venirli a parlamento seco; 89 poi farà sì, ch’al vento di Focara 90 non sarà lor mestier voto né preco».
query.result:
**English:**
85 That traitor who sees with only one eye, 86 and holds the land that here with me 87 he would like to see fasting,
88 will make them come to a parley with him; 89 then he will make it so that in the wind of Focara 90 they will not need vows or prayers.
**Malay:**
85 Pengkhianat itu yang melihat hanya dengan satu mata, 86 dan memegang tanah yang di sini bersamaku 87 dia ingin melihatnya berpuasa,
88 akan membuat mereka datang berunding dengannya; 89 kemudian dia akan membuatnya sehingga di angin Focara 90 mereka tidak akan membutuhkan sumpah atau doa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 E io a lui: «Dimostrami e dichiara, 92 se vuo’ ch’i’ porti sù di te novella, 93 chi è colui da la veduta amara».
query.result:
**English:**
91 And I to him: "Show me and declare, 92 if you want me to carry news of you up there, 93 who is he with the bitter gaze."
**Malay:**
91 Dan aku kepadanya: "Tunjukkan dan nyatakanlah, 92 jika kau ingin aku membawa berita tentangmu ke atas sana, 93 siapakah dia yang berpandangan pahit itu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 Allor puose la mano a la mascella 95 d’un suo compagno e la bocca li aperse, 96 gridando: «Questi è desso, e non favella.
query.result:
**English:**
94 Then he placed his hand on the cheek 95 of one of his companions and opened his mouth, 96 shouting: "This is he, and he does not speak.
**Malay:**
94 Kemudian dia meletakkan tangannya di pipi 95 salah seorang temannya dan membuka mulutnya, 96 berteriak: "Ini dia, dan dia tidak berbicara.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 Questi, scacciato, il dubitar sommerse 98 in Cesare, affermando che ’l fornito 99 sempre con danno l’attender sofferse».
query.result:
**English:**
97 This one, being driven out, drowned doubt 98 in Caesar, affirming that he who is supplied 99 always suffered waiting with loss.
**Malay:**
97 Orang ini, setelah diusir, menenggelamkan keraguan 98 dalam Caesar, menegaskan bahwa orang yang diperlengkapi 99 selalu menderita menunggu dengan kerugian.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 Oh quanto mi pareva sbigottito 101 con la lingua tagliata ne la strozza 102 Curïo, ch’a dir fu così ardito!
103 E un ch’avea l’una e l’altra man mozza, 104 levando i moncherin per l’aura fosca, 105 sì che ’l sangue facea la faccia sozza,
106 gridò: «Ricordera’ti anche del Mosca, 107 che disse, lasso!, “Capo ha cosa fatta”, 108 che fu mal seme per la gente tosca».
query.result:
**English:**
100 Oh, how terrified I seemed 101 with my tongue cut in my throat, 102 Curio, who was so bold to speak!
103 And one who had both hands cut off, 104 raising his stumps in the murky air, 105 so that the blood made his face filthy,
106 cried out: “Remember Mosca too, 107 who said, alas!, ‘The deed is done’, 108 which was an evil seed for the Tuscan people.”
**Malay:**
100 Oh, betapa takutnya aku kelihatan 101 dengan lidahku terpotong di tenggorokanku, 102 Curio, yang begitu berani untuk berbicara!
103 Dan seorang yang kedua tangannya terpotong, 104 mengangkat tunggulnya di udara yang gelap, 105 sehingga darah membuat wajahnya kotor,
106 berteriak: “Ingat juga Mosca, 107 yang berkata, kasihan!, ‘Perbuatan itu telah dilakukan’, 108 yang merupakan benih jahat bagi orang-orang Tuscan.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 E io li aggiunsi: «E morte di tua schiatta»; 110 per ch’elli, accumulando duol con duolo, 111 sen gio come persona trista e matta.
query.result:
**English:**
109 And I added to them: "And death to your lineage"; 110 so that he, accumulating grief upon grief, 111 went away like a sad and mad person.
**Malay:**
109 Dan aku menambahkan kepada mereka: "Dan kematian bagi keturunanmu"; 110 sehingga dia, yang mengumpulkan duka demi duka, 111 pergi seperti orang yang sedih dan gila.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Di sé facea a sé stesso lucerna, 125 ed eran due in uno e uno in due; 126 com’ esser può, quei sa che sì governa.
query.result:
**English:**
124 He made a lantern of himself for himself, 125 and they were two in one and one in two; 126 how it can be, He knows who governs it thus.
**Malay:**
124 Dia menjadikan dirinya sendiri sebagai lentera bagi dirinya sendiri, 125 dan mereka berdua dalam satu dan satu dalam dua; 126 bagaimana mungkin, Dia yang mengatur demikian mengetahuinya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
127 Quando diritto al piè del ponte fue, 128 levò ’l braccio alto con tutta la testa 129 per appressarne le parole sue,
130 che fuoro: «Or vedi la pena molesta, 131 tu che, spirando, vai veggendo i morti: 132 vedi s’alcuna è grande come questa.
query.result:
**English:**
127 When he was right at the foot of the bridge, 128 he raised his arm high with his whole head 129 to press his words upon us,
130 which were: “Now see the grievous punishment, 131 you who, while still breathing, go seeing the dead: 132 see if any is as great as this.
**Malay:**
127 Ketika dia tepat di kaki jembatan, 128 dia mengangkat lengannya tinggi-tinggi dengan seluruh kepalanya 129 untuk menekankan kata-katanya kepada kami,
130 yang berbunyi: “Sekarang lihatlah hukuman yang menyakitkan, 131 kamu yang, saat masih bernapas, pergi melihat orang mati: 132 lihatlah apakah ada yang sebesar ini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 E perché tu di me novella porti, 134 sappi ch’i’ son Bertram dal Bornio, quelli 135 che diedi al re giovane i ma’ conforti.
query.result:
**English:**
133 And so that you may carry news of me, 134 know that I am Bertran de Born, he 135 who gave evil advice to the young king.
**Malay:**
133 Dan agar kamu membawa berita tentangku, 134 ketahuilah bahwa aku adalah Bertran de Born, dia 135 yang memberikan nasihat buruk kepada raja muda.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 Io feci il padre e ’l figlio in sé ribelli; 137 Achitofèl non fé più d’Absalone 138 e di Davìd coi malvagi punzelli.
query.result:
**English:**
136 I made the father and the son rebellious against each other; 137 Ahithophel did no more to Absalom 138 and David with the evil counselors.
**Malay:**
136 Aku membuat sang ayah dan sang anak memberontak terhadap satu sama lain; 137 Ahitofel tidak berbuat lebih banyak untuk Absalom 138 dan Daud dengan para penasihat yang jahat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
139 Perch’ io parti’ così giunte persone, 140 partito porto il mio cerebro, lasso!, 141 dal suo principio ch’è in questo troncone.
query.result:
**English:**
139 Because I departed with such people joined, 140 having departed, I carry my brain, alas!, 141 from its beginning which is in this trunk.
**Malay:**
139 Karena aku berangkat dengan orang-orang yang demikian bersatu, 140 setelah berangkat, aku membawa otakku, aduh!, 141 dari awalnya yang ada di batang pohon ini.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
142 Così s’osserva in me lo contrapasso».
query.result:
**English:**
142 Thus is observed in me the contrapasso.
**Malay:**
142 Begitulah terlihat padaku hukuman setimpal.
